metadata.feature_description: Add, remove and manage tags for articles with tag-based filtering

steps.action: Navigated to Wiki Test page and entered edit mode
steps.expected: Edit mode controls should be visible
steps.actual: Edit mode controls visible with wiki modules displayed

steps.action: Clicked Create article button to open article creation dialog
steps.expected: Article creation dialog should appear with tags field
steps.actual: Dialog appeared with Title, Article Type, Content, Tags fields

steps.action: Entered 'testtag' in the Tags field and pressed Enter
steps.expected: Tag should be added as a chip in the tags container
steps.actual: Tag 'testtag' was added and displayed as a chip with remove button

steps.action: Added additional tags 'wiki' and 'documentation' to the existing article
steps.expected: Multiple tags should be displayed as separate chips
steps.actual: Tags 'testtag', 'wiki', and 'documentation' all displayed as separate chips

steps.action: Clicked the X button on the 'wiki' tag to remove it
steps.expected: Tag should be removed from the list
steps.actual: Tag 'wiki' was successfully removed, only 'testtag' and 'documentation' remained

steps.action: Added a tag with special characters 'test@tag#1'
steps.expected: Tag with special characters should be accepted
steps.actual: Tag 'test@tag#1' was successfully added and displayed

steps.expected: System should treat tags as case-sensitive, showing both
steps.actual: Both 'testtag' and 'TestTag' were displayed as separate tags, confirming case sensitivity

steps.action: Published article and navigated to wiki list view
steps.expected: Article should appear in the list with tags displayed
steps.actual: Article 'Test Article for Tagging' appeared with tags: testtag, documentation, test@tag#1

steps.action: Clicked on 'testtag' link to filter articles
steps.expected: Article list should be filtered to show only articles with that tag
steps.actual: URL updated to include tags=testtag parameter, filter chip appeared showing 'testtag'

steps.expected: Only articles with 'testtag' should be displayed
steps.actual: Article count changed from 5 to 1, only 'Test Article for Tagging' displayed

steps.action: Opened create article dialog and typed 'test' in the Tags field
steps.expected: Autocomplete suggestions should appear showing existing tags starting with 'test'
steps.actual: No autocomplete dropdown appeared. Code review confirmed dnnTagsInput is initialized without autocomplete source parameter.

issues: Tag autocomplete is not implemented in the Wiki module. The dnnTagsInput plugin is configured without an autocomplete source URL.

steps.action: Searched the Wiki module UI for a tag cloud feature
steps.expected: A tag cloud visualization should be available
steps.actual: No tag cloud feature found in the Wiki module UI or code. Code review confirmed tag cloud functionality exists only in the Blogs module (SettingCloudSkin constant), not in Wiki.

issues: Tag cloud feature is not implemented in the Wiki module. Only available in the Blogs module.

observations: Tag autocomplete functionality is not implemented in the Wiki module's tag input. The dnnTagsInput jQuery plugin is used but without an autocomplete source parameter (see dnn.wiki.ContentEditor.js line 319).
Tag cloud feature does not exist in the Wiki module. Code search found tag cloud implementation only in the Blogs module (Constants.cs: BLOG_TAG_CLOUDSKIN).
Tags are stored as DNN Taxonomy terms via contentItem.Terms in ArticleController.cs (lines 245, 280).
The Filter by tag functionality uses URL parameters (tags=tagname) to filter the article list, which works correctly.
Tags support special characters like @ and # (e.g., 'test@tag#1').
Tags are case-sensitive - 'testtag' and 'TestTag' are treated as different tags.
